pageContext.claim: “I don't like what's happening in Cuba. As you know, President Obama gave them a pass. And I didn't like it. Neither do Cuban people, based on the people that came from Cuba and suffered in Cuba. I don't like what he did. I've ended much of it, most of it.”
pageContext.analysis: Obama did not end the Cuban embargo, but he did renew diplomatic relations and struck several bilateral agreements with the island nation. Trump reversed some of these changes but left many of them in place, including Obama's decision to reopen an embassy in Havana. Among other changes, Trump is redefining what it means to be part of the Cuban military, which could bar some U.S. companies from doing business in Cuba.
